result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda Fay McShane

defendant.name: McShane, Brenda Fay
defendant.address: 4648 West Deer Run Drive #103, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brenda Fay McShane appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan appeared by video for Brenda Fay McShane.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a projected plea hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brenda Fay McShane in court with Attorney Thomas James Flanagan.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brenda Fay McShane in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Thomas Flanagan, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 10-01-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Brenda Fay McShane in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/21/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with All Tri-City banks in Milwaukee County and R.R.W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brenda Fay McShane in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/19/22 @ 1:30p
